How, then, did open become the default for so many tools and applications? Because when you use irrevocable open/free licenses, you lock your code open, defending it from anyone who would lock it up again‚Äîincluding a future version of you, in a moment of weakness.

Open licenses have served us well for more than two decades, but they need help if we‚Äôre going to survive the era in which computers invade our bodies and the structures we keep those bodies in. #

This Note to Self episode
